file_content.text: The Empire and I owe you for this. Thank you.
The Gormak have been destroyed.
Everything in that listening post is dead now.
My lord, thank you.
The job's done.
Excellent work, hunter! You've more than earned your pay.
The listening post is ours.
Thank you. I'll make sure Intelligence hears about your part in this. Though they probably already know.
I should go there at once. Deciphering the Gormak's controls will keep me busy for a while.
I want to know if you hear anything interesting.
You owe me a favor now.
I'll remember.
Alone? That's stupid.
With the Voss staging battles for their monoliths, the Gormak are distracted. Imperial reinforcements should be here before they notice.
Have fun playing with your little Gormak toys.
Whatever. I'm done here.
I'd better get to work. Thank you again.
Let me know as soon as you've captured the listening post. I'll have to move quickly.
Finally! It's about time the Empire sent people here!
Could I have a moment of your time, my lord?
Hunter! A moment, please? I'll make it worthwhile.
It's good to see another agent out here. Do you have a moment?
Wait! Could I speak with you for just a moment?
I need assistance with a mission that's of great interest to the Empire. And the Voss needn't hear about it.
Tell me what you want. And don't try my patience.
I'll listen for now.
Thank you, my lord.
What does the Empire want so badly that it can't mention to the Voss?
Oh really? Tell me more.
You want this done and kept quiet? That won't be cheap.
How much are you paying?
The Empire is paying--and it has deep pockets.
I'm not foolish enough to agree without hearing the details first, so why don't you start talking?
What sort of mission?
A perfectly reasonable answer.
What are you up to that requires secrecy?
Why keep it from the Voss?
Sounds suspicious.
The Voss don't care about the value of the Gormak technology; they hate it for being Gormak. But it is valuable to the Empire.
Intelligence believes that the Gormak monoliths nearby are part of some surveillance system.
They're tied in to a listening post. If the Empire had that facility, we could monitor all of the Republic's movements.
So, I clear the Gormak out of the facility, and you use it to spy on the Republic.
You want me to capture it.
Exactly.
Just tell the Voss you want to take over the listening post. They seem happy enough to fight Gormak.
Get the Voss to help you.
The Voss will simply raze the listening post. "Gormak technology is an abomination" and all that rot.
You can't be certain of that.
A lot of man-hours went into finding this out. That outpost is worth twice my weight in credits.
I can't wait for reinforcements much longer.
That listening post needs to be in Imperial hands before the Voss decide to burn it.
If this place is as important as you say, then I'd be glad to claim it for the Empire.
It sounds worthwhile.
Thank you. I assure you, the Empire will be grateful for this.
How do you intend to capture the post from the Gormak?
What's your plan?
The Gormak have defended the facility with gun emplacements. If you take those out first, seizing the post should be child's play.
Once the area is secure, let me know.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
I see. I suppose I'll just have to hope reinforcements arrive in time, then.
I'm going to have to call for backup. This is such a waste of time!
